headline: Greta: I'm not sure Hillary hates the email investigation
subHeadline: Greta's 'Off the Record' comment to 'On the Record' viewers, 10/15/15: The Democratic presidential frontrunner Hillary Clinton is fundraising off the e-mail scandal. So what if she plays the 'woe is me' card?

utterances.speaker: BERNIE SANDERS, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: The American people are sick and tired of hearing about your damn emails.

utterances.speaker: HILLARY CLINTON, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Me, too, me, too.  But the fact is Secretary Clinton is in the driver's seat on how fast this investigation goes. The Republicans can't speed it up. They can't slow it down. It depends on Clinton's cooperation with the FBI. Drag her feet, it will go on forever.   The bottom line is this: Going slow, no matter what the outcome is, may be great political strategy but disappointing for the American people who deserve the answer now and deserve a race without the political games from anyone. So stay tuned, right? And that's my "Off the Record" comment tonight.

utterances.speaker: But here is what you need to pay attention to
utterances.utterance: Don't get the FBI investigation over classified emails mixed up with the Benghazi Committee. The FBI is only looking at whether Secretary Clinton mishandled classified information or not. If she did, she broke the law. If she did not mishandle classified information, she did not break the law.

utterances.speaker: It's that simple. And she and Bernie Sanders may complain about it
BERNIE SANDERS, PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: The American people are sick and tired of hearing about your damn emails.

utterances.utterance: Thank you. Me, too, me, too. But the fact is Secretary Clinton is in the driver's seat on how fast this investigation goes. The Republicans can't speed it up. They can't slow it down. It depends on Clinton's cooperation with the FBI. Drag her feet, it will go on forever.

utterances.speaker: The bottom line is this
utterances.utterance: Going slow, no matter what the outcome is, may be great political strategy but disappointing for the American people who deserve the answer now and deserve a race without the political games from anyone. So stay tuned, right? And that's my "Off the Record" comment tonight.
